### Input:
 JGS ( 5/10/01 7:03:19 PM ) The icons for variables underneath InspectItems in the Inspector look squished . They do n't seem to get as much horizontal space as in the variables view , and consequently look different . JGS ( 5/16/01 7:22:24 PM ) In fact , the whole inspector tree looks like things are squeezed together more than in the variables view tree . JGS ( 5/17/01 11:50:37 AM ) The reduced space in the inspector also results in the 'S ' for static variables getting chopped off . JGS ( 5/18/01 10:47:58 AM ) The problem is that the icons of children of an InspectItem are OverlayIcons , which are 22 pixels wide , whereas the icon for an InspectItem is a regular icon , which is only 16 pixels wide . Apparently , the Tree decides how much space to allow for icons for TreeItems based on how much space the parent item requires ( or it could be how much space the * first * TreeItem requires ) . Because of this , 22 pixel wide icons were getting squeezed into 16 pixels . There are a number of ways to fix . We could make InspectItem public API , so that JDIModelPresentation could handle its icon , thus allowing it to become an OverlayIcon . But for now , this is fixed by simply widening the InspectItem icon ( `` expression_obj.gif '' ) to be 22 pixels wide . This does n't require any code changes . After verifying , move this PR to Inactive for reconsideration after first release ? DW ( 5/21/01 6:46:53 PM ) Verified .

### Input:
 1 . Start the workbench . 2 . Open the resource perspective . 3 . Invoke Perspective | Action Sets ... 4 . Turn off the Search action set . Press OK. 5 . Invoke Perspective | Show View | Search Notice : There is no way for me to initiate a search within the view . The view is useless when the search action set is not included in the perspective . This is a valid scenario because the user may remove the search action set to make room for other , more preferred action sets . NOTES : KH ( 5/18/2001 12:42:27 PM ) Moving to ZRH EG ( 24.07.2001 21:36:20 ) there is an issue , but duplicating the search action in the view does n't look like the right solution , but I ca n't think of alternatives . DM ( 8/6/01 12:29:11 PM ) Me neither ( adding it to the context menu is not a good option . Users would not expect it there ) . So , either we decide to add the Search icon to the Search View toolbar or we live with the current solution . I prefer not to add the icon . Users can search via context menu ( at least Java search ) or activate the search action set again . I do n't think there 's API that would allow to add/remove the icon depending on the action set activation status . Waiting for input from Dave and Erich DS ( 8/7/01 11:11:37 AM ) I think you should add an action to the view local toolbar . This approach is consistent with the workbench design . Argument : Within the workbench view specific actions are usually located on the local view toolbar and editor specific actions are located on the window toolbar . This philosophy was designed to reduce action overload in the window and provide strong spatial association between a view and its actions . It is also embodied in the part API : IWorkbenchPart.getActionBars.getToolbarMgr returns a local toolbar for a view and the window toolbar for an editor . Action sets are used to add `` convenience actions '' to the window and are ultimately defined by the user , not the ISV . The user may or may not include your search action in the list of visible action sets . If the search action is not visible then some mechanism should exist to invoke the same functionality from the view itself . Maybe we need a new icon : Currently I 'm using the icon used in the tool bar for the local tool bar . Both icons are 16x16 pixels ( 0.22x0.22 inches ) Is that OK ? Waiting for EGs answer . DM ( 8/16/01 10:01:24 AM ) EG via e-mail : OK DM ( 8/16/01 10:01:41 AM ) Fixed in 2.0 stream
